spaceOS.desc: I became part of a dynamic team of great developers working on an evolving startup project creating an app for workspace users and managers. My role was focused on bringing new designs to life in our web app.
spaceOS.hl1: translating new design requirements into Angular code
spaceOS.hl3: keeping our codebase at top quality and efficiency
spaceOS.hl4: taking active part in discussions about our organisation of work and technologies used
spaceOS.tools: VS Code, Fork, Chrome DevTools, Jira, GitHub

fe1.desc: I joined a rapidly growing number of contractors working on a comprehensive platform designed to enhance planning, registering and administrating examination sessions. My primary role was to develop front-end applications in coordination with the back-end code being developed at the same time. As my experience and business knowledge grew, I transitioned to designing parts of the user interface from the scratch as well.
fe1.hl1: proactive research on readily available technology applicable in the project
fe1.hl2: implementing given prototypes and proposing corrections whenever needed
fe1.hl3: ensuring the proper user experience as well as accessibility
fe1.hl4: writing unit tests for my code
fe1.hl5: debugging font-end code and support in debugging back-end code
fe1.hl6: estimating time needed for front-end tasks

tl.desc: Over two years into the project gave me enough insight to take over a leadership role in my team. I would still design most of our prototypes but leave the development to my team and take on the responsibility for delivering whole functionalities. My focus was set on managing and meeting attainable business expectations while keeping high coding standards.
tl.hl1: keeping up to date with the big picture of the whole development process
tl.hl2: consulting development progress with architects to minimise technical debt
tl.hl3: doing peer review as well as keeping correct merge order
tl.hl4: configuring continuous integration environment and keeping it stable
tl.hl5: building and deploying newly developed code to the dedicated environment for testing
tl.hl6: holding meetings for the team (daily scrum, review / retro / planning / refinement sessions)
tl.hl7: building sprint plans based on material refined with the team
tl.hl8: coordinating work with other team leaders and development leader
tl.hl9: explaining and discussing effects of our work with the BI team
tl.hl10: supporting pre-release QA and UAT process in terms of environment maintenance, feedback gathering and scheduling improvements
tl.hl11: keeping my team members focused on our goals as well as their career progress

fe2.desc: I was welcomed back into a team building a brand new registration platform capable of scaling to offer new products as well as handling a variety of self-serve features.
fe2.hl1: developing structures unifying data coming from up to 4 separate APIs in a way that stays seamless to the end user
fe2.hl2: worked on an integration with translation management system along with switching the whole platform to a new set of translated endpoints
fe2.hl3: ensured on-the-fly language switching when parts of the interface require API re-fetching
fe2.hl4: built a mechanism handling API errors so that translated messages are easily managed

cegedim.desc: The division I worked in, the ECC (EMEA Customization Center), was responsible for deployment and technical support of Nexxus Mobile Intelligence — a leading customer relationship management system dedicated to life sciences on the market. We provided our technical skills as well as deep knowledge of the CRM in all of its supported versions to our pharmaceutical clients around the globe.
cegedim.hl2: writing reports in PL/SQL and applying them in the CRM
cegedim.hl3: optimising and correcting existing PL/SQL queries
cegedim.hl4: enhancing user experience using server-side (C#) and client-side (Javascript) scripts
cegedim.hl5: finding and applying best solutions to user-reported requests for data analysis

plum.desc: Plum is a small but feisty interactive agency specialized in e-commerce. Although I was officially employed as a tester, I quickly started doing daily tasks of a front-end developer.
plum.hl3: design, preparation, tests and sending newsletters using Freshmail

freelance.desc: As a freelancer I used to design, build and install websites (using WordPress for content management), set up and manage Google Analytics and AdWords accounts, design logos, leaets, business cards and documents.

univox.desc: Univox was an on-line shop selling music on CDs and DVDs where I helped managing the product database as well as the sales process and created advertising content.

efy.desc: I worked as a receptionist in a language school — providing customer service, carrying out entrance exams, helping with the image campaign with my picture editing skills.
